definitions.definition: a person who is owned by another person and is forced to work for and obey them

examples.text: A **former slave**, he graduated from Claflin University in South Carolina.
She treated her daughter like a slave.
Prisoners of war were regularly sold as slaves.

definitions.definition: a person who is so strongly influenced by something that they cannot live without it, or cannot make their own decisions

examples.text: We are slaves of the motor car.

definitions.definition: a device that is directly controlled by another one

wordOrigin: Middle English: shortening of Old French esclave, equivalent of medieval Latin sclava (feminine) ‘Slavonic (captive)’: the Slavonic peoples had been reduced to a servile state by conquest in the 9th cent.
